result.execSummary:
The defendant Matthew Roy Schlavensky was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal) - 3rd Offense, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 343.44(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.
DNA sample to be provided and surcharge assessed.    Complete ID process with the Sheriff's Department.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal) - 3rd Offense
charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Matthew Roy Schlavensky

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Case Called @ 10:40 AM: Defendant Matthew Roy Schlavensky in court.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant provides valid DL for State's review - issued 9/29/2015.  In light of valid DL - will argue for costs only.  Def confirms resolution.    Defendant advised of right to counsel and expertise.  Voluntary waiver of counsel accepted by Court.  Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed. Plea (OAR 3):  NC  Court accepts plea and enters JOC.  Statement by Def:  None offered.  The Court: Accepts resolution and Imposes Court Costs only with DNA Surcharge. Sample to be provided today.  Def must complete ID process w/WCSD.  Expungement process explained of DNA record thru DOJ.  Appeal Rights Given.

Case ReCalled @ 10:58 AM: Defendant Matthew Roy Schlavensky in court.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Def appears today as he thought his appearance was today, which actually was yesterday.  Per DA:  Met with Def prior to going of record today.  Offer was extended at that meeting - extensive traffic record exists to overcome.  Would like to see valid DL obtained and suggests adjournment for approx 60 days.  P/S scheduled as requested.   Warrant vacated - Advises Def that the Court is losing patience with this matter not moving forward and missed Court's appearances.  Court will not tolerate any further missed Court appearances.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 13, 2015 at 10:45 am.

10:05 am case called. Defendant Matthew Roy Schlavensky not in court.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court states warrant remains active based on failure to appear/call in at time scheduled.

ADDRESS INFO for Matthew Roy Schlavensky
Current: 210 E McArthur St, Appleton, WI 54911 United States  (Effective: 07-16-2015)
Prior: 4715 N Sagebrook Ln #a, Appleton, WI 54913
from the Court - DE may have a voluntary appearance. Warrant to remain in place until hearing.
from the DE requesting a voluntary apperance

Case Called @ 3:15 PM: Defendant Matthew Roy Schlavensky not in court.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  In light of nonappearance, Arrest Warrant authorized with Statewide Extradition.    Riverside Ruling in favor of the State.  Court authorized defafult as to companion 15TR-729 with the bond amount noted on the citation - 60 DTP or PP.
